intro: Tritoma triangularis, commonly known as the triangular tritoma, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive triangular-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Tritoma triangularis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique morphology makes it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture.
